metadata.title: CVE-2020-29568 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. Some OSes (such as Linux,FreeBSD, and NetBSD) are processing watch events using a single thread. Ifthe events are received faster than the thread is able to handle, they willget queued. As the queue is unbounded, a guest may be able to trigger anOOM in the backend. All systems with a FreeBSD, Linux, or NetBSD (anyversion) dom0 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29568` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
